text:
The #DisinformationGovernanceBoard represented an outrageous, unconstitutional attack on freedom of speech.

I fought to stop it, and welcome the failure of this attempted government censorship of Americans.

There's no room for this type of Big Brother overreach in the U.S. https://t.co/QrbTmKoNMS

We need to make it much easier to lease, go forward with oil & gas exploration, and allow pipelines that deliver them in a very environmentally sensitive way to proceed.

We don't need to beg Venezuela & Iran to produce more oil in exchange for US wealth.

https://t.co/bxPrrOVa9X

Gas prices are again at a record high – for the 9th-straight day – and diesel also keeps climbing, meaning the cost of everyday goods will keep rising because it's more expensive to transport them.

The answer is staring us in the face.

Pres. Biden must unleash American energy. https://t.co/jBFLKXoVPF

NEWS: The House passed my Strengthening Oversight for #Veterans Act, sending it to the president's desk. Expanding OIG’s authority to conduct more thorough investigations & ensure accountability is needed in the wake of the tragedy at the Fayetteville VA.

https://t.co/ULseGFArIb

Our commitment to those who have worn their nation’s uniform is sacred. I'm pleased to be supporting this bill that will help fulfill it by ensuring #veterans exposed to burn pits and other toxins as a result of their service get the care and benefits they have earned. #PACTAct https://t.co/R642FiBb8A

Illegal immigration continues to surge at the southern border – 234,088 apprehensions last month. President Biden's immigration and border security policies are a disaster, and yet he still wants to lift Title 42 and open the floodgates. That can't happen.
https://t.co/ZWRcktVUmd

The Biden admin. has relied on an inflated "Social Cost of Greenhouse Gases" figure to oppose expanding natural gas infrastructure and limiting areas available for energy production, hurting American consumers.

We need to know if that continues, and why.

https://t.co/4rg183DtnN

Our farmers and ranchers are right to be worried. We’ve got to take steps that help them continue producing the most affordable, abundant food supply in the world — not exacerbating this crisis or pretending it’s not a problem. https://t.co/NY88L2G3XC

#Recycling benefits not only the environment but also the economy. 

"Two bills backed by Sen. John Boozman, R-Ark., would boost recycling efforts nationwide"

via @ArkBusiness
https://t.co/y73PKN9vmM
Congrats to @FayAR HS East on advancing to the #NSB2022 National Finals. We'll be cheering for you. https://t.co/3ou2EQy4d9

An investment in drug courts is an investment in jobs, lives saved, and our financial future. It’s a privilege to partner with them and I enjoyed being with program leaders, graduates and advocates in Benton County on Friday to celebrate their success.

➡️ https://t.co/wF7GeoXlJm https://t.co/rIE6FZSldm

Arkansas is blessed. Our police departments are filled with humble, dedicated & courageous public servants including several who died in the line of duty last year. READ my latest weekly column applauding and paying them tribute.
#BackTheBlue #ThinBlueLine
https://t.co/9n4W7KIiV9

Law enforcement officers in Arkansas and across our nation have laid down their lives or been disabled in the line of duty.

We honor and remember these brave, dedicated heroes.

#PeaceOfficersMemorialDay https://t.co/3lwLo28Fkm

Farmers and ranchers are being crushed by rising production costs. 

From record high diesel and gas prices to more expensive feed and fertilizer, the effects of Pres. Biden’s policies are being felt on and off the farm.

#Bidenflation #FoodInflation https://t.co/xsaXZUJHmk

It was good to close out my 2021-22 Congressional Youth Cabinet of High School Juniors from Arkansas today hearing their final presentations on legislative proposals they chose, studied and collaborated on all year. 

I’m very proud of these young leaders for all their hard work. https://t.co/riVnj0Vbx9

Congratulations to @BentonvilleHS seniors Saahas Parise and Rachael Thumma on being named Arkansas's 2022 U.S. Presidential Scholars. Very proud of their academic excellence and work outside the classroom to improve their communities and our state.

https://t.co/GXHl5FDZcx

“‘Inflation cost Arkansans $452 in April,’ said Sen. John Boozman, Arkansas Republican. ‘Families, seniors on fixed incomes and single parents living paycheck-to-paycheck can’t afford necessities and have to choose which bills to pay or whether to fill prescriptions.’” https://t.co/wcktjJEbep

As a Senate ALS Caucus member, I’ve learned how #ALS affects Arkansans and other Americans. Today I appreciated the opportunity to view the flags advocates placed on Constitution Gardens representing the number of people diagnosed with this disease each year.

#ALSAwarenessMonth https://t.co/nUmDzmvi26

Government-held data is often siloed, creating problems including for veterans reliant on multiple government agencies for records and services.

The Secure Research Data Network Act can help address this challenge without sacrificing security or privacy.

https://t.co/mj9UC6yiYN
God bless Sgt. Maj. John L. Canley. We're forever proud of this native Arkansan's service and heroism. https://t.co/DcTVCZy9M1
via Politico: https://t.co/diZdJFE4V6 https://t.co/jUAIPniqZQ

Fentanyl is flooding our streets with consequences that are more deadly than ever.

We must use every resource available to stop these Mexican cartel-made drugs from flowing into our country, and strengthen substance abuse prevention and treatment efforts.
https://t.co/MNeGo2vWJe

The Biden administration takes another step away from American energy independence as prices continue to climb.

The Green New Deal is priority #1 while hardworking people struggle to fill up their tanks and heat their homes.

https://t.co/xzAHrzC3tr
